//: pseudo item, used as fuel type for engines that are animal-powered
pseudo item, only used for crafting as a required tool

description: A fluffy white seed.  While it looks like the common cotton, it is too weak and short to be turned into clothing.

//: pseudo item, used as fuel type for engines that are human-powered
pseudo item, used as fuel type for engines that are wind-powered
pseudo item, used as fuel type for CBMs that are sun-powered
pseudo item, used as fuel type for CBMs that are metabolism-powered
pseudo item, only used for as a required tool, checked for in player::amount_of

name.str_sp: a smoking device and a source of flame

//: Fist is internally represented as 'wielding a none as a weapon'

description: Several documents containing all kinds of information, customer data, and charts, kept together in a manila folder.  Pretty useless now.
A white piece of paper, with the logo of XEDRA printed on its upper left corner.  It seems to be an internal report of some kind.
A small scrap of paper with two long character sequences scribbled on it.

A sequence of overlapping numbers plotted in thermal paper, at times so densely-packed that they disappear into thick blots of oxide-colored ink.  A few number sequences repeat in an almost orderly fashion, but you can't tell whether that means anything.

A long sequence of overlapping numbers plotted in thermal paper, at times so densely-packed that they disappear into thick blots of oxide-colored ink.  The blots and numbers are arranged in a strangely pleasing pattern.
A very, very long sequence of overlapping numbers plotted in thermal paper.  It is almost 15 feet long.

A long sequence of overlapping numbers plotted in thermal paper, at times so densely-packed that they disappear into thick blots of oxide-colored ink.  The printed values increased along rhythmical waves, but the number 5 is always skipped.
A bright pink loyalty card, all the points are stamped.  This would definitely prove your fidelity to Foodplace, if that still meant anything…
A small, slender branch.  Makes passable firewood but is not useful for much else.
Some ordinary, mostly dry leaves.  They have very few uses and are thus (almost) only good for burning.
A dead plant.  Good for starting fires or making crude tailoring crafts.
A bit of dried seaweed.  It's tough, inedible, and possibly poisonous, but it could be burned or used for crafts.
A big heap of dried seaweed.  It's tough, inedible, and possibly poisonous, but it could be burned or used for crafts.

Cyanoacrylate, more commonly known as superglue, is a strong, quick curing glue with many applications.  It was a favorite of many post-Cataclysm hobbyists, but has become a sought-after trade good due to its wide applications, and the fact it has become essentially impossible to manufacture.
//: 1 charge of superglue should cover an area of 5mm^2

description: A tin of adhesive typically used to glue rubber together.  It forms a less rigid bond than typical superglue, making it ideal for projects requiring flexibility.  Typically smelly and toxic.
Glue made from boiling animal bones.  The adhesive isn't strong enough for heavy-duty usages, but it can be used as a varnish or holding together small items.
A token representing fertilization of a plant.
A heavy steel chain.  Useful as a weapon, or for crafting.  It has a chance to wrap around your target, allowing for a bonus unarmed attack.
A piece of an insect's exoskeleton.  It is light and very durable.
A piece of an insect's endoskeleton.
A cluster of membranous bubbles, each about the size of a grape, retrieved from inside a mutant insect.  They float like tiny helium balloons - perhaps they are full of a lighter-than-air gas.
A cluster of hydrostatic organs, each about the size of a baseball, retrieved from inside a kraken mutant.  Some of them seem to be lighter than air, and some seem to weigh as much as air.
A lump of exoskeleton that has undergone biosilicification.  It is acid-resistant but rather brittle.
A hundred cotton patches, bundled tightly together for storage.  Disassemble to unpack.
Twenty-five cotton sheets, bundled tightly together for storage.  Disassemble to unpack.
Fifty leather patches, bundled tightly together for storage.  Disassemble to unpack.
A hundred felt patches, bundled tightly together for storage.  Disassemble to unpack.
Fifty synthetic fabric patches, bundled tightly together for storage.  Disassemble to unpack.
//: Weight is 50 x 5750mg per patch

description: Ten construction planks securely tied together for easier transport.  Disassemble to untie them.
//: total volume is equal to 10 planks, assuming uniformity and tight stacking

description: Ten rods of rebar securely tied together for easier transport.  Disassemble to untie them.
//: total volume is equal to 10 rebars, assuming uniformity and tight stacking

description: Ten pipes securely tied together for easier transport.  Disassemble to untie them.
//: Total volume is equal to 10 pipes, assuming uniformity and tight stacking. Total weight is equal to 10 pipes + 2 short ropes, as per the crafting recipe.

description: Ten copper pipes securely tied together for easier transport.  Disassemble to untie them.
//: total volume is equal to 10 pipes, assuming uniformity and tight stacking

description: Ten sticks securely tied together for easier transport.  Disassemble to untie them.
//: total volume is greater than 10 sticks; irregular dimensions leave air gaps

description: Five long sticks securely tied together for easier transport.  Disassemble to untie them.
//: total volume is greater than 5 long sticks, since they are rough lumber and do not stack perfectly

description: Five wooden javelins securely tied together for easier transport.  Disassemble to untie them.
//: total volume is greater than 5 wooden javelins, since they are rough lumber and do not stack perfectly

description: An acrylic cube cast around a small black crystal.  It's tepid to the touch.
An unopened biollante flower, brilliant purple in color.  It may still have its sap-producing organ intact.
An empty canister, which may have once held tear gas or other substances.
A fist-sized eyeball with a cross-shaped pupil.  It seems to be made of stone, but doesn't look like it was carved.
A rock the size of your fist.  It is covered with intricate spirals; it is impossible to tell whether they are carved, naturally formed, or some kind of fossil.
A USB thumb drive.  Useful for holding software.  This one seems like it could get run over by a truck and be fine.
Some type of advanced data storage device, filled with logistical data on subterranean train routes and schedules.
A secured USB thumb drive, containing a copy of the LIXA facility's research archives.

A heavy and very durable protective case made of steel and thick plastic, locked with a six-dial combination.  A sticker with the logo of DARPA is attached to the front, but looking at the surface, you can see that another marking - formerly stenciled into the material - was recently and hastily destroyed.
Evacuation plans, disaster risk projections, personnel lists, and last-minute communications from just before the end, all scrubbed from FEMA servers and stored in an external HDD.

//: Quest item, should not spawn naturally.
description: A stack of various forms and papers with credits and debits listed all over them, detailing transactions and purchases.  Reading over them, all of the balances are mismatched, and a significant amount of money is missing.

//: Quest item, should not spawn naturally.
description: A stack of various forms and papers with credits and debits listed all over them, detailing transactions and purchases.  Reading over them, everything is in good order, whoever did these is skilled at their job.
A brass candlestick with a gold finish.

pocket_data.//1: It's specifically not rigid because volume of candlestick and candle should be additive.

//2: Based on the medium variation from https://www.amazon.com/dp/B09TNCS7HL

description: A gold chalice.
//: Based on: https://www.amazon.com/Goblets-Chalices-Glasses-Hand-Made-Decoration/dp/B09FDW2RX2/ref=sr_1_4?crid=1N9BI6VTIV08Z&keywords=gold%2Bchalice&qid=1680851190&sprefix=gold%2Bchalic%2Caps%2C305&sr=8-4&th=1

description: A large, relatively sharp blade.  Could be used to make bladed weaponry, or attached to a car.
A large, curved blade.  Could be used to assemble a scythe, or make an improvised polearm.
An 8" circular sawblade.  You could make a saw with it, or throw it.  Wielding it without sturdy gloves is a bad idea.
A hollow metal cylinder which is inserted in a tree crust in order to slowly harvest its sap.  Can be used on a maple tree between late winter and early spring to harvest maple sap.
A carved piece of wood which is inserted in a tree crust in order to slowly harvest its sap.  Can be used on a maple tree in between late winter and early spring to harvest maple sap.
Strange lights perpetually glimmer within the sharpened internals of this glass globule.
Time and the elements have reduced them to a mound of filthy ribbons.
A length of thin, relatively stiff steel wire.  Like the sort you find in chain link fences.
A length of thin, relatively stretchy coiled steel wire.  Used to produce musical notes in instruments.
A length of thin, relatively stiff wire made of mild steel.  Ubiquitously found in everyday applications such as chain link fences.
A length of thin, stiff wire made of medium steel.  Its balance between strength and flexibility makes it suitable for steel ropes and cables.
A length of strong wire made of high carbon steel.  Often used in industrial machinery and springs.
A length of thin, relatively stiff steel wire, made of hardened steel.
A length of flexible and durable steel wire, made of tempered spring steel.  Often used in industrial and automotive springs, and the wire in musical instruments.
A length of stiff wire, covered in sharp barbs.

A 6-inch square piece of finely-woven steel wire, useful for dryer lint traps and reusable coffee filter baskets.  You could put this on a window to keep mosquitoes and other bugs out if it was larger, but chain link fencing will do these days.
//: Reference tables for calculating steel mesh weight (current one assumes 100 mesh twill weave): http://www.wirecloth.com/mesh-cloth-specification-tables/

description: A rod of rebar, makes a nice melee weapon, and could be handy in constructing tougher walls and such.
A length of track, made from some planks and rails.
Some mixed cement, sand and aggregates, precombined and ready to be used in a construction project.
The tanned hide of an animal repurposed to become the head on a percussion drum.
A torch that has consumed all its fuel; it can be recrafted into another torch.
A spent magnesium flare.  It is essentially trash.
A large, heavy-duty spring.  Expands with significant force when compressed.
A motorized pushmower that seems to be broken.  You could take it apart if you had a wrench.
A small tent, just big enough to fit one person comfortably.  This tent is broken and cannot be deployed.
A family-sized tent, very bulky but with plenty of space.  This tent is broken and cannot be deployed.
A heating element, like the ones used in hotplates or kettles.  Consists of nichrome wire surrounded by electrical insulator and placed inside a steel casing.
A primitive heating element made from thin coiled steel wire.  It will degrade much quicker with use than normal heating elements, but it'll do for some applications.
A simple thermostat controlled by thermal expansion of a bimetal strip.
A large metal tank with a water faucet attached to it, primarily used to store and heat water.
//: weight and volume assumed to be from model XE36S06ST45U0 water heater <https://images.thdstatic.com/catalog/pdfImages/2d/2d7ed116-1a8c-439d-b7fe-a62a0a98f806.pdf>

description: A large metal tank with a water faucet attached to it, primarily used to store and heat water.  Large enough for a whole family.
//: weight and volume assumed to be from model XG55T06EC50UO water heater <https://images.thdstatic.com/catalog/pdfImages/7e/7e7928b1-8b4f-472a-8ee8-b48eb1e7932a.pdf>

description: A large LCD television, full of delicious electronics.
An appliance used to wash laundry, not of much use without power and water.  Can be placed as an appliance.
An appliance used to clean dishes, not of much use without power and water.  Can be placed as an appliance.
A pilot light from a gas-burning device, this particular one is a simple piezoelectric igniter.
A complex mechanical fuze.  It seems it can be used to detonate stable explosives after a short time by triggering it.
A complex mechanical fuze.  It seems it can be used to detonate stable explosives upon a solid impact.

A special forces Russian rifle chambered in 5.45 that someone has taken a plasma cutter to, cutting it in three places to comply with import restrictions.  This thing would have been hard to source, and thankfully its unique complex recoil balance system remains intact, unlike the receiver and barrel.  The telltale rainbow patterns of torch cuts mar the otherwise beautiful receiver.  A well-equipped gunsmith with time and materials could probably build a new one out of this…

variants.description: A special forces Russian rifle chambered in 5.45 that someone has taken a plasma cutter to, cutting it in three places to comply with import restrictions.  This thing would have been hard to source, and thankfully its unique complex recoil balance system remains intact, unlike the receiver and barrel.  The telltale rainbow patterns of torch cuts mar the otherwise beautiful receiver.  A well-equipped gunsmith with time and materials could probably build a new one out of this…

description: A broken camspy.  It probably won't spy on anything ever again.  Could be gutted for parts.
A broken skitterbot.  Much less threatening now that it lies limp on solid ground.  Could be gutted for parts.
A broken Hub 01 exterminatron.  Much less threatening now that it lies limp on solid ground.  Could be gutted for parts.
A broken lab defense bot, with its casing broken and fluid drained.  Could be gutted for parts.
A broken nurse bot.  Its smooth face stares vacantly into empty space.  Could be gutted for parts.
A broken grocery bot.  Its smiling face stares vacantly into empty space.  Could be gutted for parts.
The body of a busted grocery bot.  Its tarnished face is still smiling.  Could be gutted for parts.
A broken prototype robot--well, more broken than before.  Could be gutted for parts.
A broken miner bot.  Much less threatening now that it's no longer capable of drilling anything.  Could be gutted for parts.
A broken mech exoskeleton suit, it looks beyond repair.
A broken mech exoskeleton suit, it looks beyond repair.
A broken mech exoskeleton suit, it looks beyond repair.
A broken riot dispatch, with its mesh midsection filled with fried manhacks and its motor limp and still.  Could be gutted for parts.
A piece of paper.  Can be used to start fires.
A book binder.  With a pen and some paper you could copy some recipes from books into it.
A broken military dispatch.  Though the scratched manhacks visible in its belly are disarmed, their destructive potential still inspires a spark of fear in you, even now.  Could be gutted for parts.
A broken manhack.  Much less threatening now that it lies limp on solid ground.  Could be gutted for parts.
A broken grenade hack.  Much less threatening now that it lies quiet on solid ground.  Could be gutted for parts.
A broken tear gas hack.  Much less threatening now that it lies quiet on solid ground.  Could be gutted for parts.
A broken EMP hack.  Much less threatening now that it lies quiet on solid ground.  Could be gutted for parts.
A broken flashbang hack.  Much less threatening now that it lies quiet on solid ground.  Could be gutted for parts.
A broken C-4 hack.  Much less threatening now that it lies quiet on solid ground.  Could be gutted for parts.
A broken loudspeaker.  It's so unusually quiet now…  Could be gutted for parts.
A central processor unit, useful in advanced electronics crafting.
A stick of memory.  Useful in advanced electronics crafting.
//: A stick of DDR4 SRAM is 133.35 x 31.25 x 4.2mm, or 17.5ml. We round up a touch.

description: A power supply unit.  Useful in lots of electronics recipes.
A circuit designed to amplify the strength of a signal.  Useful in lots of electronics recipes.
A circuit designed to repeat a signal.  Useful for crafting communications equipment.
A module designed to receive many forms of signals.  Useful for crafting communications equipment.
A large backlit screen, used for displaying images.  Useful in some electronics recipes.
A small backlit screen, used for displaying images.  Useful in some electronics recipes.
A high-quality glass lens, useful for focusing or diffusing light.  Might be useful for starting a fire.
A small, high-quality glass lens, useful for focusing or diffusing light.  Might be useful for crafting.
A pair of small, darkened glass lenses, like the ones used in sunglasses.
Once a valuable bionic implant, it has not held up well under repeated use.  It has been destroyed by excessive electric current and is now useless.
A state-of-the-art optical storage system.  This small slate of transparent glass holds, inscribed as a miniature pattern, the instructions required to create an item through a nanofabricator.

A state-of-the-art optical storage system.  This small slate of transparent glass holds, inscribed as a miniature pattern, the instructions required to create an item through a nanofabricator.  A small text at the bottom indicates that this one is specifically used to create combat exoskeletons.
A state-of-the-art optical storage system, containing the instruction set to replicate itself.

A state-of-the-art optical storage system, containing the instruction set required for the fabrication of complex silicon photonic circuitry.  The data within was once clearly worth millions, but now, you are not sure if it's anything more than a fancy, high-tech paperweight.
//: actually worth millions

description: A state-of-the-art optical storage system, containing the instruction set required for the fabrication of advanced armor materials.  This seems to just be routines for working with the materials, not actual armor schematics.
//: given to HUB 01 for even better armor

description: A simple thin copper shaft.  Useful in lots of electronics recipes.
A very small electric motor like those used in RC cars or electric hair trimmers.
A printed card that supports and electrically connects electronic components on a non-conductive substrate.
A random collection of resistors, capacitors, and diodes which have been stripped from printed circuits.
A system designed to convert a radio station into an autonomous repeater.
A small fan, used to propel air around a room.
//: Based on https://www.amazon.com/dp/B000U9WXEC, although the volume calculated from package dimensions has been multiplied by 0.5 because there really is not a reasonable way to calculate fan volume without the numbers going into extremes

description: A ceramic armor plate, specifically engineered for use as armor.  Not suitable for human use.
A filled fishbowl, the tag says 'to Ed' and the fish's name, 'Hoss'.  The fish appears to have tiny antlers.
A tool designed to clean the interior surface of pipes, bottles, and similar objects.  This one is thin enough to be used for cleaning firearm barrels from dirt and fouling.
A small mechanical clock, it's stopped at 10:10.
A small assortment of gears and other clockwork gubbins.
A small hand mirror.
A heavy iron disc that typically covers a ladder into the sewers.  Lifting it from the manhole is impossible without a crowbar.
A branch from a pine tree, oozing sticky sap and bristling with prickly needles.
A spiny pod from a pine tree.
//: Commercial pinecones average 300g. We're assuming wild ones weigh less than this.

description: Some cooked rice mixed with yeast and koji mold fragments, set aside to let koji mold grow on it so that it can make a passable sake base.

use_action.msg: The koji mold seems to have overtaken all the rice; this batch is usable now.
use_action.not_ready_msg: The koji mold is still growing.

description: Some rice covered in koji mold, mixed in with yeast.  Useful for making sake, but not really tasty on its own.  Smells vaguely of chestnuts.
Some cooked rice sprinkled with ash and wrapped into a corn husk.  If left alone for a while, it will most likely grow koji mold.

use_action.msg: Patches of koji mold have grown on the rice; you can now extract it.
use_action.not_ready_msg: The koji mold hasn't grown yet.

description: Some cooked rice sprinkled with ash and wrapped into a corn husk.  It has grown patches of koji mold inside; disassemble this item to extract it.
Dough made from cooked and mashed soybeans and wheat flour, wrapped in wet paper.  If left to dry for some time, it'll grow koji mold, as necessary for making soy sauce.

use_action.msg: The koji mold seems to have overtaken all the dough; this batch is usable now.
use_action.not_ready_msg: The koji mold hasn't grown yet.

name.str_sp: soy and wheat dough with koji

description: A block of dried dough made from cooked and mashed soybeans and wheat flour, covered with koji mold.  Usable for making soy sauce.
A poppy bud.  Contains some substances commonly produced by a mutated poppy flower.
The top of a sunflower, with yellow petals and some seeds that have yet to be eaten by animals.
A handful of white chamomile flowers, used as an herbal remedy since ancient times.
A lovely flower that grows on the surface of bodies of fresh water.  Traditionally connected with many Eastern cultures.
A handful of yellow-green flowers.  Can be brewed into a tea that prevents asthma attacks.
A mixed collection of flowers.  Unfortunately, they have all withered with time.
//: Estimated weight is between 1.5-2 lb. When withered, assuming 60% weight loss, gives us around 300 g.
//1: A medium sized bouquet is roughly 13" x 5.5" x 5.5", or roughly 6.4 L. When withered, I'm estimating a 30% shrinkage in volume, or 4.5 L.

description: An identification tag for a pet, engraved with their name and their owner's address and phone number.  It says "<dog_name>".
//: dog tags are roughly 50mm x 28mm x 0.4mm, or 0.56 ml, but that's so small I needed to round up to 1 ml

description: A fresh piece of clay.  Useful for some crafting recipes.
A fire-hardened building block used in masonry construction.
//: I consider this value to be too high, but lowering it further would put it below rocks, and rocks are a staple of balance due to ferals.

description: Some mortar, ready to be used in building projects.
Some lime mortar, made from quicklime and aggregate and ready for building.
A compacted mass of soil and natural fibers, still too wet to build with.  Load it onto a pallet and leave it to dry.

use_action.msg: You test the brick, and it seems solid enough to use.
use_action.not_ready_msg: The brick is still too damp to bear weight.
use_action.//: Should be about a week. Irl it's ten days, so make big batches.

description: A compacted mass of soil and natural fibers, baked dry enough to harden into a brick.
A thick, pasty mud, low in sand content to reduce crumbling once dry.  Used to glue larger, heavier pieces of mud and clay together.

description.str: A sheet of bark from a hypothetical tree.  Useful for making adding new bark items slightly simpler.

description: A sheet of tannin-rich bark from a tree, useful for tanning leather.
A sheet of tough, water-resistant bark taken from a birch tree.
A sheet of bark taken from a willow tree.  Used in the production of aspirin.
A root taken from a sassafras tree.  Used in the production of certain sweet beverages.
A sparkling diamond.
A sparkling garnet.
A sparkling amethyst.
A sparkling aquamarine.
A sparkling emerald.
A sparkling alexandrite.
A sparkling malachite.
A lustrous pearl.
A sparkling ruby.
A sparkling peridot.
A sparkling sapphire.
A lustrous opal.
A sparkling tourmaline.
A sparkling citrine.
A sparkling blue topaz.
A beautiful black onyx.
A pile of dry grass.  Can be used to craft a straw bed if there is nothing else to sleep on.
An old straw doll, made to look like a woman in a dress.
A pillow to rest your head on when sleeping.  It is rolled for compact storage and transportation.  You will automatically unroll it when you place it for sleeping.

A pillowcase with straw and other dead plants as filling.  It's better than nothing…  It is rolled for compact storage and transportation.  You will automatically unroll it when you place it for sleeping.

A big, body-sized pillow with a print of an anime character on the front and their scantily-clad version on the back.  It is rolled for compact storage and transportation.  You will automatically unroll it when you place it for sleeping.

variants.description: A big, body-sized pillow with a print of an anime character on the front and their scantily-clad version on the back.  It is rolled for compact storage and transportation.  You will automatically unroll it when you place it for sleeping.

A big, body-sized pillow with a print of an aircraft carrier drawn on both sides.  The one on the back is stripped of its armor plating, how naughty.  It is rolled for compact storage and transportation.  You will automatically unroll it when you place it for sleeping.

A big, body-sized pillow with a print of a fully-modded tacticool M4 SOPMOD II on both sides.  The rifle firing a grenade somehow looks suggestive.  It is rolled for compact storage and transportation.  You will automatically unroll it when you place it for sleeping.

A big, body-sized pillow with a print of a blue-haired Boston-Chan, the mascot of Boston AnimeCon, on both sides.  This seems to be official merch, and the art on both sides is quite tame.  It is rolled for compact storage and transportation.  You will automatically unroll it when you place it for sleeping.

A big, body-sized pillow with a print of a blue-haired Boston-Chan, the mascot of Boston AnimeCon, on both sides.  It's highly unlikely the convention would officially endorse such a lewd depiction of her.  It is rolled for compact storage and transportation.  You will automatically unroll it when you place it for sleeping.

A big, body-sized pillow with an anime-style print of Bear Grillings, Ultimate Survivor on both sides.  On one side he's holding a pneumatic air rifle, and on the other he is clad in nothing but duct tape.  The pillow is stylized to look like Kevlar.  It is rolled for compact storage and transportation.  You will automatically unroll it when you place it for sleeping.

A big, body-sized pillow with a print of an anthropomorphic fox on the front and a scantily-clad version on the back.  It is rolled for compact storage and transportation.  You will automatically unroll it when you place it for sleeping.

A big, body-sized pillow with a print of a popular blue-twintailed virtual musician on the front and her scantily-clad version on the back.  It is rolled for compact storage and transportation.  You will automatically unroll it when you place it for sleeping.

A big, body-sized pillow with a print of an anime character dressed in all black on the front and their scantily-clad version on the back.  They're surrounded by red candles and laying atop a demonic pentagram.  It is rolled for compact storage and transportation.  You will automatically unroll it when you place it for sleeping.

A big, body-sized pillow with a print of a cute maid on the front and the same maid - covered in blood and holding a knife - on the back.  It is rolled for compact storage and transportation.  You will automatically unroll it when you place it for sleeping.

A big, body-sized pillow with a print of a masculine woman on the front and her scantily-clad version on the back.  It's captioned with 'TOMBOY SUPREMACY' on both sides.  It is rolled for compact storage and transportation.  You will automatically unroll it when you place it for sleeping.

A big, body-sized pillow with a print of a feminine man on the front and his scantily-clad version on the back.  It's captioned with 'FEMBOY SUPREMACY' on both sides.  It is rolled for compact storage and transportation.  You will automatically unroll it when you place it for sleeping.

A big, body-sized pillow with a print of a pouting anime character on the front and their scantily-clad version on the back.  They don't actually like you or anything, they swear!  It is rolled for compact storage and transportation.  You will automatically unroll it when you place it for sleeping.

A big, body-sized pillow with a print of a popular anime VTuber on the front and their scantily-clad version on the back.  It is rolled for compact storage and transportation.  You will automatically unroll it when you place it for sleeping.

A big, body-sized pillow.  Someone drew a vaguely humanoid figure on it.  Its heartwarming smile fills you with joy.  It is rolled for compact storage and transportation.  You will automatically unroll it when you place it for sleeping.

description: A fluffy pillow to rest your head on when sleeping.  It is rolled for compact storage and transportation.  You will automatically unroll it when you place it for sleeping.
A medical device that bears the approval of the FDA (Food and Drug Administration).  If used properly, this pouch can keep things sterile indefinitely.
The smoke billowing from this cigar has a sweet, musty odor.
A true gentleman always finishes his cigars.
Smoke swirls from the lit end of this cigarette, filling the air with the thrilling smell of burning chemicals.

What was once a wonderfully addictive tube of dried tobacco leaf is now just a smelly piece of trash.  What a tragedy!
The leftover tobacco in a few of these could probably be used to roll another cigarette.  If you're willing to go that far…
The smell of skunk permeates the air as a thin trail of smoke floats off of this joint.

The smoked-down butt of a joint, a reminder of some good times.  Pretty much trash now.  Bummer, man.
A few of these could probably be used to roll another joint.

A psychoactive plant indigenous to Central Asia and the Indian subcontinent traditionally cultivated for its fiber, oil, for medicinal purposes, and for use as a recreational drug.  It requires further processing to be useful.
Various parts of a tobacco plant, full of nicotine.  They need to be dried to become smokable.

description.str: A generic plastic card item template with numbers based off a credit card.

//: Based on my own cash card that I measured with a ruler. Yes I'm professional like that. 8.4cm x 5.3cm x 0.1cm. Really it's slightly less than 5ml but we don't do volume lower than 1ml.

description: A yellow plastic card used to electronically store money.  It holds up to 2 million dollars.
A small, transparent card that was attached to the prototype robot's CPU.  It might contain the data the intercom spoke of.

//: Item for meteorologist mission.
description: A memory bank containing the information collected by the meteorologist drone.
This card gives you a little discount on the purchase of gasoline.
This card gives you a good discount on the purchase of gasoline.
This card gives you a splendid discount on the purchase of gasoline.
A small neoprene patch.  Can be used to repair neoprene clothing.
A rather outdated light bulb used in all sorts of lighting equipment.
A twisted shard of jagged metal.
A nice-looking clay pot used for planting.
A cheap plastic pot used for planting.
This 3 L jar contains a human brain preserved in a formaldehyde solution.
A set of long, snakelike tubes for evaporating refrigerant.
A compressor and fan that work together to cool down refrigerant.
A small tank containing some sort of refrigerant often used in devices such as freezers.  Hermetically sealed to prevent evaporation - cannot be opened without prior connection to a compatible valve.
An armor plate made of very thick steel, specifically engineered for use in a bullet-resistant vest.
A steel armor plate, specifically engineered for use in a bullet-resistant vest.
A small lock, with its key still inserted.
This is an in-progress craft.
This is an in-progress disassembly.
A bumper-mounted rig for attaching and storing a spare tire on the back of a vehicle.  Combine it with a wheel to get a mountable piece.
An amplifier head.  Typically paired with a speaker cabinet for amplifying musical instruments.  Basically only good for spare parts now.
A broken turret.  Much less threatening now that it's laid limp on solid ground.  Could be gutted for parts.

This is a big, bulky military-level parachute, designed to slow the fall of up to a thousand kilograms of cargo dropped from an aircraft.  You have no clue how to put all the straps back in their place.

A hand-made humanoid figure, useful for training in close quarters combat.  This one is made from wood and has some duct tape to mark the striking points.  Use the construction menu (* by default) to embed it into the ground for training.
